did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, programs, scrapbooks, photographs, notebooks, recordings, miscellany.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, programs, scrapbooks, photographs, notebooks, recordings, and miscellany concerning the Cornell University Glee Club, including the complete managerial papers from 1929 to 1980.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Founded as the Orpheus Glee Club in 1868, the Cornell University Glee Club (CUGC) is the oldest student organization on campus. One of the premier male choirs in the country, the ensemble performs a wide variety of repertoire, frequently traveling domestically and internationally. Past international concert tours have visited Mexico, the Soviet Union, Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe, China, Venezuela, and Brazil. Since 1889, the Club has been under the leadership of a number of notable directors.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection includes bound managerial papers, correspondence, and financial papers for every year from 1929 to 1976 (excluding war years), scrapbooks, photographs, programs, notebooks, recordings, songbooks, and miscellany concerning the Cornell University Glee Club (CUGC), its managers, directors, members, and alumni. Includes materials related to directors, managers, and advisory council members.

Also, scrapbooks (1954-55); USSR/England tour (1960-61); publicity and managerial records (1951-65); and an LP album, "Cornell music," consisting of music of the Glee Club, the Cornell chimes, and the Cornell Concert Band. Also microfilmed minutes and a poster for a Glee Club concert in the Philippines.
Contact the Glee Club Historian with questions.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Glee Club records, #37-6-2399. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Box 26 of Cornell University Media Services Photo Section records, #21-37-2227, for photos of the Glee Club Asia tour in January 1989. Job # 1434, 16 rolls, each with many frames, taken by Gordon Webb.
See also collection #3-13-2843 for a VHS tape of the 1989 Asia Tour.
See also Cornell University Songs and Sheet Music collection, #47-6-2124, http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/EADresolver?id=RMA02124.
See also the Music Library for many recordings.

scopecontent.p: Includes invitation to a reception from the Ambassator to the United States in Manila in honor of the Cornell Glee Club
Including an invitation for the Glee Club to sing in the California Capital Rotunda on their 2011 California Tour
